Package logic.player

Class SocketPlayer.ServerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.player.Player
      • logic.player.SocketPlayer
        • logic.player.SocketPlayer.ServerPlayer
  • Enclosing class:
    SocketPlayer
    public static class SocketPlayer.ServerPlayer
extends SocketPlayer
    Represents a server socket player. This is always player 2.
    Represents a player connected via a web socket.
    Represents a player in the game. Stores the player's hand.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private static class  SocketPlayer.ServerPlayer.Accepter
      Accepts a connection on the server socket.
      Represents a thread for running a blocking operation.
      private static class  SocketPlayer.ServerPlayer.ConnectingMessage
      Shown while waiting for a client to connect.
      private class  SocketPlayer.ServerPlayer.Rejecter
      Rejects any subsequent connections to the server socket.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerPlayer

        public ServerPlayer​(Game game,
                    short port)
        Constructor for ServerPlayer.
        Parameters:
        game - The UI game handler the player belongs to.
        port - The port the socket is on.

    • Method Detail

      • getSocket

        protected void getSocket()
        Gets the socket connection and exchanges player names. In this case this is done by creating a new server socket and showing a connection screen until a client connects. Any future connections are rejected. Send the other player's name first, then receives its own name.
        Specified by:
        getSocket in class SocketPlayer

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        Called when the game ends. In this case close the socket if it is open after sending the winner. If the server socket is open close that too.
        Overrides:
        gameOver in class SocketPlayer
